}} 'Bartolomeo Bimbi' (1648â1723) was a Florentine painter of still lifes,
spurred by his patrons including Cosimo III, Grand Duke of Tuscany to paint
large canvases of flora and fauna for the Medici Villa dell'Ambrogiana and della
Topaia, now conserved in the Pitti Palace and the Museo Botanico
dell'Universita.

He partly was following the tradition of Jacopo Ligozzi in documenting the
botanical collections of the Medici. He was a pupil of Lorenzo Lippi and Onorio
Marinari. Others claim he was a pupil of Angelo Gori.
